title: 107_hr3710
content: The Act may be cited as the "Colon Cancer Screen for Life Act of 2002". Congress acknowledges the importance of colon cancer screening. The "Colon Cancer Screen for Life Act of 2002" emphasizes the underutilization of colorectal cancer screening tests under the Medicare program and calls for the use of more effective screening technologies. Colorectal cancer screening tests have faced significant reimbursement reductions under the Medicare program. Unlike other preventive screening tests, providers must consult with beneficiaries before a screening colonoscopy to gather medical and family history and provide preparatory steps information. However, reimbursement for these consultations is currently not available under Medicare, despite being provided for similar consultations before a diagnostic colonoscopy. Increase in reimbursement for colorectal cancer screening and diagnostic tests under Medicare. The Social Security Act is amended to provide enhanced payment for colorectal cancer screening and diagnostic tests under Medicare, with a 10 percent increase above the relative value units for specific codes. The Social Security Act is amended to provide enhanced payment for colorectal cancer screening and diagnostic tests under Medicare, with a 10 percent increase above the relative value units for specific codes. Additionally, the Secretary shall establish national minimum payment amounts for certain CPT and HCPCS codes, reflecting a 30 percent increase above the relative value units in effect as facility rates for those codes in 2001. The Social Security Act is amended to provide enhanced payment for colorectal cancer screening and diagnostic tests under Medicare, with a 10 percent increase above the relative value units for specific codes. The revised payment level applies to items and services performed in a facility setting, with annual adjustments starting from January 1, 2003. The effective date for this amendment is July 1, 2002. MEDICARE COVERAGE OF OFFICE VISIT OR CONSULTATION PRIOR TO A SCREENING COLONOSCOPY OR IN CONJUNCTION WITH A BENEFICIARY'S DECISION TO OBTAIN SUCH A SCREENING. Medicare coverage is expanded to include an outpatient office visit or consultation for beneficiary education and preparation prior to a colorectal cancer screening test, specifically a screening colonoscopy. This coverage is provided regardless of medical necessity. The Social Security Act is amended to include coverage for outpatient office visits or consultations related to colorectal cancer screening tests under Medicare. The payment amounts for these services will be 80 percent of the lesser of the actual charge or the established amount. The Social Security Act is amended to include coverage for outpatient office visits or consultations related to colorectal cancer screening tests under Medicare. Payment for outpatient office visits or consultations prior to screening colonoscopy will be consistent with the payment amounts for specific CPT codes. The amendments made by this section will apply to items and services provided on or after July 1, 2002. SEC. 5. WAIVER OF DEDUCTIBLE FOR COLORECTAL CANCER SCREENING TESTS. The deductible for colorectal cancer screening tests under the Social Security Act shall not apply, effective July 1, 2002.
